decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [TFL-0000-20 MER 40 Rev B, TFL-0000-01 MER 40 Rev A, TFL-0000-03 MER 40 Rev A, TFL-0000-06 A Rev F, Planning, Design & Access Statement, EV Charging Points Arboricultural Technical Note and Methodology Site reference: #Mer40.]

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Tree Protection: The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document [ EV Charging Points Arboricultural Technical Note and Methodology Site reference: #Mer40 ]shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified on the Arboricultural Technical Note and Methodology shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works. Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy G7 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and 02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay].
site_name: Electric Vehicle Charging Point Outside 3 And 5
description: APPLICATION FOR THE INSTALLATION OF ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING INFRASTRUCTURE ON THE CARRIAGEWAY ADJACENT TO 3 - 5 LONDON ROAD.
